title: Strong Correlation of PROMIS Upper Extremity and Shoulder Arthroplasty Smart Score to ...

summary.text: The study found an excellent-good correlation between ASES and PROMIS UE at both 6 months (r =0.647) and a minimum 2-year follow-up (r =0.761), indicating strong agreement between these measures.

An excellent-correlation was observed between ASES and SAS scores, with correlations of r =0.748, r =0.738, and r =0.688 at the 6-month, 1-year, and 2-year follow-ups respectively, demonstrating consistent performance across time points.

Ceiling effect analysis revealed low ceiling effects for both PROMIS UE and SAS scores at the minimum 2-year follow-up (0.91% and 0.00% of patients reaching maximum scores respectively), suggesting these measures are sensitive to changes in patient outcomes over time.
